intro: Grevea madagascariensis subsp. keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan grevea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
